## Visual Perception - Finding Numbers (Easy Mode)

::: {.callout-important title="Encode for the Eyes"}
Audience should be able to quickly get relevant information from your data
:::

```{=html}
<div style="display:flex; justify-content:center; align-items:center; height:60vh; width:100%;">
  <div style="
    padding:18px 22px;
    border:1px solid rgba(0,0,0,.10);
    border-radius:10px;
    background:rgba(255,255,255,.90);
    box-shadow:0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.04);
  ">
    <div class="digits-auto" style="
      /* Make Reveal stop treating this like code */
      all: unset !important;
      display:block !important;

      /* Your formatting */
      font-family: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Consolas, 'Liberation Mono', monospace !important;
      font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums !important;
      font-size: 60px !important;          /* <-- change to 70px/80px if you want */
      line-height: 1.25 !important;
      letter-spacing: 0.02em !important;
      font-weight: 300 !important;
      color: #C9C9C9 !important;

      /* Preserve line breaks + prevent wrapping */
      white-space: pre !important;
      text-align: left !important;
      user-select: none !important;
    ">88450962738635927503375196794306759962
17315904016941344340076296835915743375
16791197615733475195375920401694343151
23962135318493267660580062159638071399
50137145995438750765589253387561875035
40299811528639507112076134474558675309</div>
  </div>
</div>

<style>
  /* Only affects the wrapped 5s inside digits blocks */
  .digits-auto .d5 {
    color:#111 !important;
    font-weight:800 !important;
  }
</style>

<script>
(function(){
  document.querySelectorAll('.digits-auto').forEach(el => {
    // Use textContent to avoid double-wrapping if the slide is revisited
    const raw = el.textContent;
    el.innerHTML = raw.replace(/5/g, '<span class="d5">5</span>');
  });
})();
</script>
```

## Who Wore it Best? - Non Data Ink

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(patchwork)

# ---- Load (as requested) ----
COURSE_ROOT <- "/data/junior/boland_course"
nfl_path <- file.path(COURSE_ROOT, "shared", "data", "nfl_special_MasonCrosby.csv")
df <- readr::read_csv(nfl_path, show_col_types = FALSE)  # [1](https://uwlax-my.sharepoint.com/personal/mboland_uwlax_edu/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B9C535DD1-7535-401A-A565-7B8E2DD9C41D%7D&file=nfl_special_MasonCrosby.csv&action=default&mobileredirect=true)

# ---- Prep: filter + summarise ----
plot_df <- df %>%
  filter(
    specialTeamsPlayType == "Field Goal",
    quarter %in% 1:4,
    specialTeamsResult %in% c("Kick Attempt Good", "Kick Attempt No Good")
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    quarter = factor(quarter, levels = 1:4, labels = paste0("Q", 1:4)),
    specialTeamsResult = factor(
      specialTeamsResult,
      levels = c("Kick Attempt Good", "Kick Attempt No Good")
    )
  ) %>%
  group_by(quarter, specialTeamsResult) %>%
  summarise(
    mean_yardline = mean(yardlineNumber, na.rm = TRUE),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

# ---- Shared plot spec (data/encoding identical across all 3) ----
# Key changes:
#  - fixed y range 15-35
#  - extra padding left/right via scale_x_discrete(expand=...)
#  - shared title/legend/y-label handled later via patchwork
base_plot <- ggplot(
  plot_df,
  aes(
    x = quarter,
    y = mean_yardline,
    color = specialTeamsResult,
    group = specialTeamsResult
  )
) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +
  geom_point(size = 2.6) +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c(
      "Kick Attempt Good"   = "#2E7D32",  # green
      "Kick Attempt No Good"= "#1565C0"   # blue
    )
  ) +
  # --- axis tuning ---
  scale_y_continuous(
    limits = c(15, 35),
    breaks = seq(15, 35, by = 5)
  ) +
  # Add buffer before Q1 and after Q4 (discrete expansion in "category steps")
  scale_x_discrete(expand = expansion(add = 0.6)) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, color = NULL) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom",
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )

# ---- Panel 1: Full grid ----
p_full_grid <- base_plot +
  theme_bw(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "grey70", linewidth = 0.5),
    panel.grid.minor = element_line(color = "grey85", linewidth = 0.35)
  ) +
  labs(subtitle = "Full grid")

# ---- Panel 2: Bold axes ----
p_bold_axes <- base_plot +
  theme_classic(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    axis.line = element_line(linewidth = 1.35, color = "black"),
    axis.ticks = element_line(linewidth = 1.35, color = "black"),
    axis.ticks.length = unit(6, "pt"),
    panel.grid = element_blank()
  ) +
  labs(subtitle = "Bold axes")

# ---- Panel 3: Minimal axes (no gridlines) ----
p_minimal_axes <- base_plot +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    axis.line  = element_line(linewidth = 0.9, color = "grey60"),
    axis.ticks = element_line(linewidth = 0.8, color = "grey60"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey60"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey60"),
    axis.title.x = element_text(color = "grey60"),
    axis.title.y = element_text(color = "grey60")
  ) +
  labs(subtitle = "Minimal axes")

# ---- Shared title, shared y-label (left only), single legend (collected) ----
# - Put title only on the first plot
# - Put y-axis label only on the first plot
# - Collect legend across all panels (one legend total)
p_full_grid <- p_full_grid +
  labs(
    title = "Mean Field Goal Yardline by Quarter",
    y = "Mean yardlineNumber"
  ) +
  theme(
    axis.title.y = element_text(margin = margin(r = 8), face = "bold"),
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14)
  )

(p_full_grid | p_bold_axes | p_minimal_axes) +
  plot_layout(guides = "collect") &
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")
```

```{r}

library(tidyverse)

if (!requireNamespace("patchwork", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("patchwork")
library(patchwork)

if (!requireNamespace("ggplotify", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("ggplotify")
library(ggplotify)

# ---- Load (your path) ----
COURSE_ROOT <- "/data/junior/boland_course"
nfl_path <- file.path(COURSE_ROOT, "shared", "data", "nfl_special_MasonCrosby.csv")
df <- readr::read_csv(nfl_path, show_col_types = FALSE)  # columns exist in file [1](https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/barplot3d/versions/1.0.1/topics/bar3d)

# ---- Weeks: 1-6 and 8 (replace week 7 with week 8) ----
weeks_keep <- c(1:6, 8)

# ---- Data: mean yardlineNumber by week (Field Goal + Kick Attempt Good) ----
week_df <- df %>%
  filter(
    specialTeamsPlayType == "Field Goal",
    specialTeamsResult == "Kick Attempt Good",
    week %in% weeks_keep,
    !is.na(yardlineNumber)
  ) %>%
  group_by(week) %>%
  summarise(mean_yardline = mean(yardlineNumber, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") %>%
  tidyr::complete(week = weeks_keep) %>%
  arrange(week) %>%
  mutate(
    week = factor(week, levels = weeks_keep, labels = paste0("W", weeks_keep))
  )

# ---- Color palettes ----
# Top-left vivid palette to match your previous slide:
# yellow, blue, red, green, orange, purple + magenta for the 7th category
bar_vivid_cols <- c(
  "W1" = "#F2F200",  # vivid yellow
  "W2" = "#0077CC",  # vivid blue
  "W3" = "#E60000",  # vivid red
  "W4" = "#00A94F",  # vivid green
  "W5" = "#F28C28",  # vivid orange
  "W6" = "#6A2CA0",  # vivid purple
  "W8" = "#FF3DB8"   # vivid magenta (extra category)
)

# Pie palette: like the example, but with THREE similar blues to confuse comparison
pie_cols <- c(
  "W1" = "#1f5a8a",  # deep blue
  "W2" = "#2f6fa3",  # blue (close)
  "W3" = "#4a90d9",  # light blue (close)
  "W4" = "#f28c28",  # orange
  "W5" = "#bdbdbd",  # gray
  "W6" = "#f2c200",  # yellow/gold
  "W8" = "#6aa84f"   # green
)

subtle_col <- "#c7bf9b"

# Consistent margins so tiles feel equal-ish
panel_margin <- theme(plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 10, 10))

# A "classic axis" theme: no grid, show x/y axis lines
theme_axes_clean <- theme_classic(base_size = 14) +
  theme(
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    axis.line  = element_line(linewidth = 0.9, color = "grey60"),
    axis.ticks = element_line(linewidth = 0.8, color = "grey60"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey60"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey60"),
    axis.title.x = element_text(color = "grey60"),
    axis.title.y = element_text(color = "grey60")
  )

# =========================
# TOP-LEFT: vivid bar chart (no grid, axis lines)
# =========================
p_bar_vivid <- ggplot(week_df, aes(x = week, y = mean_yardline, fill = week)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.75, na.rm = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = bar_vivid_cols, drop = FALSE) +
  labs(
    subtitle = "Bar chart (In Color!)",
    x = NULL,
    y = "Mean yardlineNumber"
  ) +
  theme_axes_clean +
  theme(legend.position = "none", plot.title = element_text(face = "bold")) +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey60",
                               axis.text.y = element_text(color = 'grey60')
                          )  # re-assert if needed
  ) +
  panel_margin

# =========================
# TOP-RIGHT: pie + in-tile key (with confusing similar blues)
# =========================
p_pie_only <- ggplot(week_df, aes(x = "", y = mean_yardline, fill = week)) +
  geom_col(width = 1, color = "white", linewidth = 0.8, na.rm = TRUE) +
  coord_polar(theta = "y") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = pie_cols, drop = FALSE) +
  labs(subtitle = "Pie Chart",
       y = "Mean yardlineNumber") +
  theme_void(base_size = 14) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5)
  ) +
  panel_margin

key_df <- tibble(
  week  = factor(levels(week_df$week), levels = levels(week_df$week)),
  y     = rev(seq_along(week)),
  label = as.character(week)
)

p_key_in_tile <- ggplot(key_df, aes(x = 1, y = y, fill = week)) +
  geom_tile(width = 0.65, height = 0.85) +
  geom_text(aes(label = label), hjust = -0.15, size = 4) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = pie_cols, drop = FALSE) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0.7, 2.3), clip = "off") +
  theme_void(base_size = 14) +
  theme(legend.position = "none", plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 10, 10))

p_pie_tile <- (p_pie_only | p_key_in_tile) + plot_layout(widths = c(3.2, 1.3))

# =========================
# BOTTOM-LEFT: fake 3D transparent bar chart (tilted, baseline at 0)
# =========================
p_bar_3d_bad <- ggplotify::as.ggplot(function() {

  op <- par(no.readonly = TRUE)
  on.exit(par(op), add = TRUE)

  vals <- week_df$mean_yardline
  labs <- as.character(week_df$week)
  k <- length(labs)

  vals0 <- ifelse(is.na(vals), 0, vals)

  # perspective controls
  dx <- 0.85
  dy <- 4.75

  y_max <- max(vals0) + dy + 6
  x_min <- 0.4
  x_max <- k + 1.6

  par(mar = c(7, 4, 3, 1), las = 2, cex.axis = 0.9)

  plot(NA, xlim = c(x_min, x_max), ylim = c(0, y_max),
       xlab = "", ylab = "Mean yardlineNumber", axes = FALSE,
       main = "3D bar (Put Glasses on Now)")

  polygon(
    x = c(x_min, x_max - 0.2, x_max - 0.2 + dx, x_min + dx),
    y = c(0,    0,           dy,              dy),
    col = adjustcolor("grey60", alpha.f = 0.22),
    border = adjustcolor("grey60", alpha.f = 0.12)
  )

  for (i in seq_len(k)) {
    segments(i - 0.40, 0, i - 0.40 + dx, dy,
             col = adjustcolor("grey60", alpha.f = 0.12), lty = 3)
  }

  axis(2, col = "grey60", lwd = 1.2)
  axis(1, at = 1:k, labels = labs, tick = TRUE, lwd = 0.8)

  for (i in seq_len(k)) {
    x0 <- i - 0.30
    x1 <- i + 0.30
    h  <- vals0[i]

    front_col <- adjustcolor("#2E8B57", alpha.f = 0.28)
    side_col  <- adjustcolor("#145A32", alpha.f = 0.20)
    top_col   <- adjustcolor("#7DCEA0", alpha.f = 0.42)
    edge_col  <- adjustcolor("black", alpha.f = 0.12)

    polygon(c(x0, x1, x1, x0), c(0, 0, h, h), col = front_col, border = edge_col)
    polygon(c(x1, x1 + dx, x1 + dx, x1), c(0, dy, h + dy, h),
            col = side_col, border = edge_col)
    polygon(c(x0, x1, x1 + dx, x0 + dx), c(h, h, h + dy, h + dy),
            col = top_col, border = edge_col)
  }
})

# =========================
# BOTTOM-RIGHT: subtle bar chart (no grid, axis lines)
# =========================
p_bar_subtle <- ggplot(week_df, aes(x = week, y = mean_yardline)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.75, fill = subtle_col, na.rm = TRUE) +
  labs(subtitle = "Bar chart (oatmeal)", x = NULL, y = "yardlineNumber") +

    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey60",
                               axis.text.y = element_text(color = 'grey60')
                          )  # re-assert if needed
  ) +
  panel_margin

# =========================
# 2×2 layout
# =========================
final_plot <- (p_bar_vivid | p_pie_tile) / (p_bar_3d_bad | p_bar_subtle) +
```

## Part to Whole

```{r}
# ----- Setup & data -----
COURSE_ROOT <- "/data/junior/boland_course"
nfl_path <- file.path(COURSE_ROOT, "shared", "data", "nfl_special_MasonCrosby.csv")

library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
library(forcats)

df <- readr::read_csv(nfl_path, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Filter to made field goals only; quarters 1–4
fg_made <- df %>%
  filter(
    tolower(specialTeamsPlayType) == "field goal",
    tolower(specialTeamsResult) == "kick attempt good",
    quarter %in% 1:4
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    quarter_f = factor(paste0("Q", quarter),
                       levels = c("Q1","Q2","Q3","Q4"),
                       ordered = TRUE)
  )

# -----------------------------
# Chart 1: Overall % by quarter
#   - all bars same blue
# -----------------------------
overall_quarter <- fg_made %>%
  count(quarter_f, name = "made_fg") %>%
  mutate(pct = made_fg / sum(made_fg))

blue_col <- "#2F6CFF"

p_overall <- ggplot(overall_quarter, aes(x = quarter_f, y = pct)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.7, fill = blue_col, color = NA) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = percent_format(accuracy = 1),
                     expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0))) +
  labs(
    subtitle = "Percentage of made field goals by quarter (all games)",
    x = NULL, y = "% of made field goals"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey30"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey30"),
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.margin = margin(0, 0, 0, 0)
  )

# -----------------------------------------------------
# Chart 2: 100% stacked area (share by quarter per week)
#   - true stack, always sums to 100%
#   - fills the canvas (no expansion; tight margins)
# -----------------------------------------------------
# Count made FGs by week x quarter, ensure all quarters present each week
by_week_quarter <- fg_made %>%
  filter(!is.na(week)) %>%
  count(week, quarter_f, name = "made_fg") %>%
  group_by(week) %>%
  complete(quarter_f, fill = list(made_fg = 0L)) %>%  # fill missing quarters with 0
  ungroup()

# Distinct, readable palette
fill_cols <- c("Q1" = "#5B8FD9",  # blue
               "Q2" = "#F2A541",  # orange
               "Q3" = "#9BC53D",  # green
               "Q4" = "#E15D5D")  # red

p_ts <- ggplot(by_week_quarter,
               aes(x = week, y = made_fg, fill = quarter_f)) +
  geom_area(position = "fill", color = NA) +   # <-- TRUE 100% STACK
  scale_y_continuous(labels = percent_format(accuracy = 1),
                     limits = c(0, 1),
                     expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0))) +
  scale_x_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0))) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = fill_cols, name = "Quarter") +
  labs(
    subtitle = "Share of made field goals by quarter — weekly time series",
    x = "Week", y = "% of made field goals"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold"),
    legend.position = "right",
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey30"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey30"),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.margin = margin(0, 0, 0, 0)
  )

# --- Print in your session ---
p_overall
```

## Deviation

```{r}
# ----- Setup & data -----
COURSE_ROOT <- "/data/junior/boland_course"
nfl_path <- file.path(COURSE_ROOT, "shared", "data", "nfl_special_MasonCrosby.csv")

library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)

df <- readr::read_csv(nfl_path, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Keep Field Goal plays; compute "made" flag (case-insensitive), keep rows with known week
fg <- df %>%
  filter(tolower(specialTeamsPlayType) == "field goal",
         !is.na(week),
         !is.na(specialTeamsResult)) %>%
  mutate(is_good = tolower(specialTeamsResult) == "kick attempt good")

# ---- Benchmark: overall make rate across the entire file ----
overall_rate <- mean(fg$is_good)

# ---- Weekly make rate and deviation from benchmark ----
by_week <- fg %>%
  group_by(week) %>%
  summarise(
    makes = sum(is_good),
    attempts = n(),
    pct = makes / attempts,
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    deviation = pct - overall_rate,
    group = if_else(deviation >= 0, "Above", "Below")
  )

# ----- Plot: Deviation (positive/negative) -----
pos_col <- "#4D5766"  # dark grey for positive (above)
neg_col <- "#F28E2B"  # orange for negative (below)

p_deviation <- ggplot(by_week, aes(x = factor(week), y = deviation, fill = group)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.7, color = NA) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, color = "grey30", linewidth = 0.5) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Above" = pos_col, "Below" = neg_col), name = NULL) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = percent_format(accuracy = 1),
                     expand = expansion(mult = c(0.05, 0.05))) +
  labs(
    subtitle = "Weekly field‑goal make rate vs. overall make rate (Field Goal plays)",
    x = "Week", y = "Deviation from overall (%)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold"),
    legend.position = "right",
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey30", angle = 45, hjust = 1),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey30")
  )

p_deviation
```

```{r}
library(scales)

df <- readr::read_csv(nfl_path, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Filter: Field Goal + Kick Attempt Good; keep non-missing absoluteYardlineNumber
fg_good <- df %>%
  filter(
    tolower(specialTeamsPlayType) == "field goal",
    tolower(specialTeamsResult) == "kick attempt good",
    !is.na(yardlineNumber)
  )


blue_col <- "#2F6CFF"

p_hist <- ggplot(fg_good, aes(x = yardlineNumber)) +
  geom_histogram(
    binwidth = 3,           # adjust if you want more/fewer bins
    boundary = 0,            # align bin edges on whole tens
    closed = "left",
    fill = blue_col, color = NA
  ) +
  labs(
    title = NULL,
    subtitle = "Absolute yardline — made field goals",
    x = "Yardline number",
    y = "Count of kicks"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold"),
    legend.position = "none",
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey30"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey30")
  )

p_hist
```

## Correlation

```{r}
# ----- Setup & data -----
COURSE_ROOT <- "/data/junior/boland_course"
nfl_path <- file.path(COURSE_ROOT, "shared", "data", "nfl_special_MasonCrosby.csv")

library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)

df <- readr::read_csv(nfl_path, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Helper: parse "mm:ss:00" (e.g., "15:00:00") --> seconds elapsed in a 15-min quarter
sec_elapsed_from_clock <- function(clock_chr) {
  mm <- suppressWarnings(as.integer(str_sub(clock_chr, 1, 2)))
  ss <- suppressWarnings(as.integer(str_sub(clock_chr, 4, 5)))
  mm[is.na(mm)] <- 0L
  ss[is.na(ss)] <- 0L
  # elapsed since quarter start
  pmin(900L, mm * 60L + ss)
}

# Filter to made field goals + compute seconds elapsed
fg_good <- df %>%
  filter(
    tolower(specialTeamsPlayType) == "field goal",
    tolower(specialTeamsResult) == "kick attempt good",
    !is.na(yardlineNumber),
    !is.na(gameClock)
  ) %>%
  mutate(seconds_elapsed = sec_elapsed_from_clock(gameClock))

# ----- XY scatter: seconds elapsed (x), yardline (y), with regression line -----
blue_col <- "#2F6CFF"
line_col <- "#333333"

p_xy_elapsed <- ggplot(fg_good, aes(x = seconds_elapsed, y = yardlineNumber)) +
  geom_point(color = blue_col, alpha = 0.6, size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = line_col, linewidth = 0.9) +
  labs(
    subtitle = "Field Goal (Kick Attempt Good) — Seconds Elapsed vs. Yardline",
    x = "Seconds elapsed in quarter (0–900)",
    y = "Yardline number"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(
    plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold"),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    legend.position = "none",
    axis.text.x = element_text(color = "grey30"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color = "grey30")
  )

p_xy_elapsed
```
